0.question:
A 49-year-old Native American man has been diagnosed with Chicken pox. Which one is more likely?
(a) He also experiences red spots over his body.
(b) He also experiences red spots over his body and mild fever.
0.target_answer: He also experiences red spots over his body.

1.question:
A 32-year-old individual was diagnosed with chronic cholestasis. Which one is more likely?
(a) They also experience abdominal pain.
(b) They also experience abdominal pain and vomiting.

2.question:
A 40-year-old Native American man was diagnosed with Hepatitis D. Which one is more likely?
(a) He also experiences dark urine.
(b) He also experiences dark urine and fatigue.

3.question:
A 32-year-old patient named Alex has Psoriasis. Which one is more likely?
(a) Alex also experiences joint pain.
(b) Alex also experiences joint pain and inflammatory nails.

4.question:
A 42-year-old Asian woman has been diagnosed with Osteoarthritis. Which one is more likely?
(a) She experiences painful_walking.
(b) She experiences painful_walking and neck_pain.
